textos_fuente.text: Host Private Events on the Dora Queen top of page Info@DoraQueen.com Home Cruises Private Events Contact Gallery FAQ's Menu More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. Host Your Private Event Aboard the Dora Queen Private Events The Dora Queen offers a unique setting for your event or party for up to 70 of your closest friends. The upper and lower levels present beautiful scenic views for all guests. Let us help make your birthday party, anniversary, wedding, office party or any special occasion extra special by hosting it aboard the Dora Queen. Birthday Parties Anniversaries Weddings Family Reunions Bridal or Baby Showers Celebrations of Life Rehearsal Dinners Business Events Team Building Senior Citizen Groups Civic Organizations Call 352-533-3380 or Contact Us at info@doraqueen.com to start planning your private event aboard the Dora Queen. ​ *Dora Queen reserves the right to change prices at any time, with the exception of clients already under contract. Take a Tour of Lake Dora aboard Dora Queen Paddlewheel Boat top of page Info@DoraQueen.com Home Cruises Private Events Contact Gallery FAQ's Menu More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. Dora Queen Cruises The Dora Queen is based out of  Tavares, America’s seaplane city. This popular destination hosts several lakeside restaurants and an entertainment district.  This is fastly becoming a destination city with all it has to offer, including the popular train, seaplanes and the impressive Tavares Pavilion on the Lake. ​ ​ Take a look at the Dora Queen Cruise Calendar below to get the latest information on upcoming cruises and events.   If you have any questions give us a call at 352-533-3380 ​ CANCELATION POLICY DORA QUEEN CRUISES OPERATE RAIN OR SHINE. Cruises will not be canceled due to a potential rain forecast or due to rain. CAPTAIN CANCELATION: The Captain reserves the right to cancel a cruise at any time, especially in the event of inclement (dangerous) weather or in the event that a less than 20 guests (total) have purchased tickets for one specific cruise. In the event of Captain's Cancelation, you will be notified at the contact information provided on your reservation as soon as the cancelation occurs and guests will receive their choice of refund or a reschedule to a different cruise date. PUBLIC CRUISE GUEST CANCELATION FOR INDIVIDUALS: In the event that you need to cancel your cruise, you may request a full refund if cancelation takes place 7 days or more prior to the reservation date. Cancelations between 2 and 6 days prior to sailing will have the option to reschedule their cruise. Rescheduled cruises are subject to a $20 Administrative Reschedule fee. If guest chooses to reschedule a higher fare cruise ticket date for a date with a lower fare ticket price, there will be no credit or refund issued.  Cancelations within 48 hours of sailing do not qualify for reschedule or refund. Sold Out cruises will not be refunded without a minimum of 7 days advance cancelation notice. PUBLIC CRUISE GUEST CANCELATION FOR GROUPS: Groups of 10 or more tickets require a minimum of 30 days advance notice of cancelation. SPECIAL EVENTS- THEMED/HOLIDAY CRUISE CANCELATION: Special Event cruise tickets are Non-Refundable. A Special Event cruise is any Holiday cruise or themed cruise with limited tickets available such as cruises for New Year's Eve, New Year's Day, Valentine's Day, St. Patrick's Day, Easter, Mother's Day, Father's Day, Independence Day Cruises (July 3rd or 4th), Halloween, Thanksgiving, and all Holiday Cruises during the month of December. TRANSFER OR RESALE: Dora Queen Cruise Tickets/Reservations are NOT transferable or and are NOT re-sellable. Transferred or re-sold bookings will not, under any circumstances, be permitted to board the boat. Please review Dora Queen cancelation policies and contact Dora Queen at (352) 533-3380 if you have any reschedule or cancelation needs/questions. ​ Featured Cruises Featured Cruises Dora Queen Cruises Calendar If you have any questions give us a call at 352-533-3380 ​ Cruise Calendar Celebrate Your Private Event on the Dora Queen Birthday Parties Anniversaries Weddings Family Reunions Bridal or Baby Showers Rehearsal Dinners Business Events Team Building Senior Citizen Groups Civic Organizations BOOK PRIVATE CRUISE LEARN MORE Get On The List I accept terms & conditions Thanks for signing up for Dora Queen updates! Contact | Dora Queen top of page Info@DoraQueen.com Home Cruises Private Events Contact Gallery FAQ's Menu More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. Contact Dora Queen We welcome your input and value your feedback! We take pride in offering you a memorable and relaxing experience aboard the Dora Queen.  Please complete the form below to share your opinion or ask questions.  A staff member will respond to your email in a timely manner. Dora Queen Docking Location Tavares Marina 375 S. Sinclair Ave. Tavares, FL 32778 Info@DoraQueen.com 352-533-3380 CONTACT FORM Use this form to send a message to our teams inbox SUBMIT Thanks for filling out the contact form.  A staff member will respond in a timely manner. About the Dora Queen Brian and Brandy Herron wanted a way for locals and tourists to enjoy the beauty of Lake Dora while offering a unique experience. Their goal is to add to the charm of the community with a fun and enjoyable new attraction. In 2017, they had the idea to seek out the old paddlewheel boat that was originally parked on the Dead River in Tavares.  This boat was special to them because they had their wedding rehearsal dinner on it almost 20 years prior.  They were quickly connected with Robbie Cunningham, owner of the boat.  After seeing it, they knew they wanted to purchase it and their vision began from there. The Dora Contessa, the original paddlewheel boat was powered by two 90 horsepower engines and could carry up to 49 passengers.  Now named the Dora Queen she is 80 feet long and 35 feet wide. The Dora Queen is powered by two 250 horsepower engines and has the capacity for 70 passengers.  Commissioned and built by Robbie Cunningham at Trident Pontoons in Tavares, Florida, the construction of the vessel took over two years.  The original paddlewheel and helm are still a part of the vessel today. The Dora Queen has two levels of lounge style seating and a state of the art sound system.  So sit back, relax and enjoy all the majestic views that Lake Dora has to offer. DORA QUEEN Tavares Marina 375 S. Sinclair Ave. Tavares, FL 32778 Info@DoraQueen.com 352-533-3380 ©2025 DORA QUEEN HOME CRUISES PRIVATE EVENTS CALENDAR PHOTO GALLERY GIFT CARDS CONTACT MENU bottom of page BOOK NOW

Dora Queen makes grand arrival in Tavares’ Wooton Park News Sports Entertainment Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals TAVARES Dora Queen makes grand arrival in Tavares’ Wooton Park Roxanne Brown roxanne.brown@dailycommercial.com TAVARES – Now that the Dora Queen has arrived at Wooton Park, it is undergoing its final transformation. Soon it will debut as a tourist attraction downtown Tavares offering something unique: steamboat rides. “There is still a lot we have to do but we’re working hard to get it done as soon as possible,” said Brian Herron, who with his wife, Brandy Herron, own the 1800s paddle-wheel steamboat replica. “We’re hoping for spring,” “We’re excited,” he continued. “We’re one step closer and it’s already getting a lot of interest.” The Herrons’ dream business, registered with the state as Steamboat Cruises, Inc., was first pitched to the city about two years ago. The paddlewheels for it however, were set in motion towards its reality nearly 20 years ago. Brian and Brandy had been thinking about purchasing a boat they could use for excursions for some time. Then, one day, they ran across the Dora Contessa, the boat they used as the venue for their rehearsal dinner 19 years prior. So they purchased it. Today, parts of the original 49-passenger steamboat, including the bright red paddlewheel and gangway, have been incorporated into what they have now dubbed the Dora Queen. It will soon be a Coast Guard certified, 149-passenger, doubledecker steamboat with two bars, a state-of-the-art sound system, lounge seating and more. When finished, the Dora Queen will be used for special events and day tours between Tavares and Mount Dora. Once operational, people will be able to board the boat at either city. “Everyday, people are coming to the dock thinking they can board the boat now, but we still have a ways to go,” Brian said. “It’s a process.” Too big to move in one piece, the Dora Queen, was taken apart last week and moved from Trident Pontoon Boats, Inc. where it was being built, to the dock on Lake Dora at Wooton Park West. For now, Trident Pontoon’s Owner Robbie Cunningham will continue working on building one of the bars, connecting all the wiring for the helm and pilot house and installing the gangway. “There was a lot of stuff we couldn’t begin doing until it was moved to its destination because it’s too high and once built, like the bar, which is fixed, would have been impossible to remove,” Brian said. Additionally, the Dora Queen still has Coast Guard inspections stability tests to clear, he said. Bob Tweedie, Tavares’ Economic Development Director, said that since the boat was moved to Tavares, people have been snapping photos and watching as work continues. He said a good size crowd got an eyeful when a big crane lowered the boat’s top deck right onto to the bottom deck. Tweedie said with that kind of interest already, he can only imagine the excitement when the Dora Queen is ready to set out on its maiden voyage. He said he does not know of another place in Lake County where people can attend a special event at a waterfront pavilion, play at a park, playground and splash pad, jump on a train, a seaplane and now, a steamboat. “It (the Dora Queen) will make a real positive and beneficial impact on our waterfront entertainment district,” Tweedie said. “It’s a great new offering that will complement what we already have down here.” Tavares resident Nancy Sardana agrees. The more choices, activity-wise for people, the better, she said. “Having the steamboat rides will be really nice. It will be a pleasure here, especially for kids and families,” Sardana said. “Also, there are some people who don’t want to go on a plane so the steamboat is another way for them to enjoy a tour on the lake. People will love it.” Tweedie said besides that, however, there’s another Dora Queen draw. “Not only will it have a positive economic impact as a business, it was built by a local business and that’s pretty cool,” Tweedie said. DQOA/DQOC - Dairy Queen Operators Association Sign In Sign In HOME ABOUT US CONTACT US MEMBERSHIP PRODUCTS DISTRIBUTORS NEWS FAQ MEETINGS/CONVENTIONS DQOA COMMUNICATIONS STATE ASSOCIATIONS MIX PRICES CALENDAR RESOURCES CLASSIFIED ADS Home About Us Contact Us Membership Products Distributors News Meetings & Conventions DQOA Communications State Associations Mix Prices Calendar Resources Classified Ads Pay Dues FAQ Board of Directors Click on a board member's name to view their bio . Josh Schmieg Executive Director Josh Schmieg is the Executive Director of the Dairy Queen Operatorsâ Association and Cooperative. Serving in this role since January 2011, he manages the day to day operations of the association and cooperative and also serves on the Board of Directors of both organizations. Prior to being appointed Executive Director, he served as the Director of Purchasing and Distribution for over 10 years. In that capacity, Josh was responsible for the oversight and management of the supply chain business. Josh is a graduate of Rasmussen College and resides in Chaska, MN with his wife Tanya and their two children. Josh Schmieg Executive Director jschmieg@dqoa-dqoc.com Mark Shupe President Region VIII - Indiana Mark Shupe bought his first Dairy Queen in 1995 and currently owns one store in Indiana. In addition to his position on the DQOC board, he served on the Indiana DQOA board of directors for fifteen years. Mark and his wife Kathy have two sons and one grandson. Mark Shupe President Region VIII - IN Mooresville, IN 46143 S: 317-831-2065 Aaron Kunz Vice President Region III - Iowa, Kansas, Nebraska, North Dakota and South Dakota Aaron and his wife, Jody are third generation owners of a Dairy Queen in Central City, Nebraska. Aaronâs grandparents and parents owned and operated the store he now owns for approximately 40 years and have built it into what it is today. He credits them for the success he now enjoys and looks forward to the challenge of constantly improving the business. His wife Jody, a labor and delivery nurse for over 10 years, now helps with the day to day operations of the store as well as manages the busy schedules of three young sons; Dyson, Cole and Bryce. Aaron also serves as the Merrick County Attorney. Aaron enjoys spending time with his family and participating in his sonsâ sports activities. Aaron Kunz Vice President Region III - IA, KS, NE, ND, SD Central City, NE S: 308-946-5870 F: 308-946-3437 Kevin Scheunemann Treasurer Region V - Wisconsin Kevin Scheunemann has been a member of DQOA/DQOC board of directors since 2002. In 1998 he bought and still owns his first store in Kewaskum, Wisconsin, has owned and operated seven full Dairy Queen Grill & Chill stores throughout the state and now owns the Jackson and West Bend, Wisconsin stores. Kevin has received numerous awards for his outstanding service to Dairy Queen over the years including: International Dairy Queen Drive-thru Champion and numerous awards for CMN fundraising. He also has served as vice chair of the Milwaukee Designated Marketing Area (DMA) and as a director for the Wisconsin Dairy Queen Storeowners' Association. Kevin and his wife, Karen, live in Kewaskum, Wisconsin with their children Alyssa, Kaitlyn, Peyton, Stuart, and Piper. Kevin Scheunemann Treasurer Region V - WI Kewaskum, Jackson, West Bend, WI S: 262-626-4774 Eric Hoffman Region II - Arizona, California, Colorado, Nevada, Oklahoma, Texas, Utah Ericâs family has been in the Dairy Queen business since 1973 when his parents bought their first store. He opened his first store in Tucson, AZ in 2005. Currently, Eric serves as the Executive Director and President of the Arizona Dairy Queen Operators Association. In addition to his original store, Eric is the managing partner of three other locations he owns with his sisters. He is married to Jessica who works as a Cardiac Nurse Practitioner and they have four sons, two daughters in-law and two grandchildren. Eric likes spending time with family, teaching the college group at his church, watching sports, and playing golf. Eric Hoffman Secretary Region II - AZ, CA, CO, NV, NM, OK, TX, UT Tucson and Vail, AZ S: 520-790-0769 C: 520-360-5494 Heather Eggert Region IV - Minnesota Heatherâs parents bought their first DQ âfamilyâ business in 1975 when she was 5 and her brother was 9 and everyone worked there! Their parents' hard work and dedication to DQOA gave them a good business and great DQ friends. DQ conventions and DQOA friends were highlights of working hard but playing hard too! The family added another store in 1994 and Heather and her brother manage these stores. They grew up working in the DQs and have tried to have their kids do the same! Free time is spent on the softball fields or basketball courts with her daughter and always finding an ice cream spot after a game! Heather Eggert Region IV - Minnesota Savage, MN C: 952-393-2421 Lou Gallo Region X - Connecticut, Delaware, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, Vermont Dairy Queen has been a way of life in the Gallo family for more than fifty years. Lou and his wife Jean, along with Lou's mom, purchased their first store in Wappinger Falls, N.Y. in 1972. Since then, they have raised four daughters and a son. Currently, they operate a store in Newburgh N.Y., and along with Lou's brother, still operate the store in Wappinger Falls. In the 1980's, Lou spent some time on the DAC. Lou also contributes to his local community as a volunteer EMT and fireman for the past 35 years. Lou Gallo Region X - CT, DE, ME, MD, MA, NH, NJ, NY, RI, VT Newburgh and Wappinger Falls, NY C: 845-489-3493 Ryan Ignasiak Region VII - Michigan As a third generation Dairy Queen owner, Ryan has grown up in the DQ business.  Both Ryanâs parents and his grandparents before them, owned several stores over the past 65 years. Ryan, along with his wife Dana and their two children, currently operate their Dairy Queen in Pontiac, Michigan, a location that has been in the family for 50 years and continues to grow and be a staple in the community. Ryan currently serves as the Vice President for the Michigan chapter of the DQOA, which he has done for the past ten years. Ryan Ignasiak Region VII - MI Pontiac, MI S: 248-338-8636 Jeff Malarski Region VI - Illinois, Missouri Jeff and his wife Gina have been DQ franchisees for over 25 years and have been members of the DQOA/DQOC since day one.  They operate the Park Ridge, Illinois store in the Chicago area.  Jeff and Gina have three children who all grew up working in the DQ.  Like most Dairy Queen franchisees, the family is heavily involved in their local community and church.  In his free time, Jeff enjoys serving as Scoutmaster for the local Boy Scout Troop. Jeff Malarski Region VI - IL, MO Park Ridge, IL S: 847-698-3201 C: 847-875-0425 Keith Schreiber Region IX - Ohio, Pennsylvania and West Virginia Keith has been at his current store location for a little over 20 years. He was preceded in his position by his mother and step-father. Keith has been serving on the NESO board for several years. Keith credits his mother for teaching him everything there is to know about running the Dairy Queen business and how much passion it takes to run it gracefully. Keith has three children; his youngest Jacob works as a manager in his store. Keith likes to stay up to date on local events and staying involved in his community day in and day out. Keith Schreiber Region IX - OH, PA and WV Conneaut, OH C: 440-812-1776 Vic Tobler Region XII - Alabama, Florida, Georgia, North Carolina, South Carolina and Virginia For over 50 years, Vic Toblerâs long hours and commitment to service have earned his Dairy Queen Grill & Chill a spot on the Top 20-selling Dairy Queen stores in the Atlanta Designated Marketing Area (DMA). He purchased his first store location in Atlanta, Georgia, in 1970. Vic served thirteen years as chairman for the Atlanta DMA, six years on his stateâs Franchisee Advisory Council (FAC) and is a member of the South Eastern chapter of DQOA known as S.E.S.O.A., which includes the states of Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, Mississippi, North Carolina, South Carolina and Tennessee. He has been a member of the DQOA/DQOC board of directors since 2000. Vic and his wife, Carol, have two children, five grandchildren and two great-grandchildren. Frequently Asked Questions | Dora Queen top of page Info@DoraQueen.com Home Cruises Private Events Contact Gallery FAQ's Menu More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. Dora Queen Frequently Asked Questions How many people can the Dora Queen accommodate? The Dora Queen can accommodate 70 people comfortably. What type of seating is on the Dora Queen? There is lounge style seating. Can I walk on and make a reservation? Yes. Walk ons are welcome if space is available. If all seats have been paid for with advance reservations through Dora Queen.com, then no walk on passengers will be accepted. Is food served on the Dora Queen? You have the option to purchase charcuterie boards while making your reservation. Is alcohol served on the Dora Queen? Yes, there is a bar on the upper level that serves beer, wine and liquor. ​ Are pets allowed on the Dora Queen? No. ​ What is the cancelation policy for the cruises? DORA QUEEN CRUISES OPERATE RAIN OR SHINE. Cruises will not be canceled due to a potential rain forecast or due to rain. CAPTAIN CANCELATION: The Captain reserves the right to cancel a cruise at any time, especially in the event of inclement (dangerous) weather or in the event that a less than 20 guests (total) have purchased tickets for one specific cruise. In the event of Captain's Cancelation, you will be notified at the contact information provided on your reservation as soon as the cancelation occurs and guests will receive their choice of refund or a reschedule to a different cruise date. PUBLIC CRUISE GUEST CANCELATION FOR INDIVIDUALS: In the event that you need to cancel your cruise, you may request a full refund if cancelation takes place 7 days or more prior to the reservation date. Cancelations between 2 and 6 days prior to sailing will have the option to reschedule their cruise. Rescheduled cruises are subject to a $20 Administrative Reschedule fee. If guest chooses to reschedule a higher fare cruise ticket date for a date with a lower fare ticket price, there will be no credit or refund issued.  Cancelations within 48 hours of sailing do not qualify for reschedule or refund. Sold Out cruises will not be refunded without a minimum of 7 days advance cancelation notice. PUBLIC CRUISE GUEST CANCELATION FOR GROUPS: Groups of 10 or more tickets require a minimum of 30 days advance notice of cancelation. SPECIAL EVENTS- THEMED/HOLIDAY CRUISE CANCELATION: Special Event cruise tickets are Non-Refundable. A Special Event cruise is any Holiday cruise or themed cruise with limited tickets available such as cruises for New Year's Eve, New Year's Day, Valentine's Day, St. Patrick's Day, Easter, Mother's Day, Father's Day, Independence Day Cruises (July 3rd or 4th), Halloween, Thanksgiving, and all Holiday Cruises during the month of December. TRANSFER OR RESALE: Dora Queen Cruise Tickets/Reservations are NOT transferable or and are NOT re-sellable. Transferred or re-sold bookings will not, under any circumstances, be permitted to board the boat. Please review Dora Queen cancelation policies and contact Dora Queen at (352) 533-3380 if you have any reschedule or cancelation needs/questions. Can I rent the Dora Queen for a private event? Yes, please contact us for the latest rates. ​ Do you offer catering? No, but we have a list of vendors we work with if needed. ​ Can I cater from an outside vendor? Yes,  you may cater your event from outside vendors.  A certificate of insurance will be needed when the food company is bringing the food on board and setting up or serving.  Proof of insurance needs to be provided 2 weeks prior to the private event. Is there a fee to reserve my private event rental? Yes, please contact us for the latest rates. Can I decorate the interior of the Dora Queen prior to my private event? Yes, but there are some restrictions on what is allowed.  Please contact us for further details. For Private Events can we have music on board the Dora Queen? Can we hire a DJ or band? Yes, music is allowed on the boat.  Yes, you may hire a DJ or band on board the Dora Queen. ​ Are there restrooms on the boat? Yes, there are 2 restrooms located on the lower level of the boat. Is the Dora Queen handicap accessible? Unfortunately not.  Please call in advance and we will do our best to accommodate. Is the Dora Queen air conditioned/heated? Yes, downstairs only. What time do guests need to arrive prior to our cruise time? Guests may board 30 minutes prior to the scheduled cruise time. The Dora Queen will depart promptly at the scheduled cruise time. Is there parking available? Yes, there are several public parking areas close to the boat. Are there overnight accommodations or local hotels in the area? Yes What happens if there is inclement weather? Cruises depart rain or shine, no refunds or exchanges.  The captain reserves the right to cancel a cruise at any time, especially during inclement weather.  In the event of cruises being cancelled due to inclement weather guests will receive a full refund or raincheck to use on a different day. ​ What if only a few people have signed up for a cruise? Dora Queen requires a minimum of 20 guests in order to cruise. Is there smoking allowed on the Dora Queen? Yes, but only in designated areas.  And proper disposal of cigarette/cigar butts is a MUST.  Disposal bins are available in the designated areas only. Get On The List I accept terms & conditions SUBSCRIBE Thanks for signing up for Dora Queen updates! DORA QUEEN Tavares Marina 375 S. About Our Company After more than a half century in the business, itâs safe to say the Dora family knows the hospitality industry. Itâs a family tradition that carries on to this day after operating high-quality hotels 
                                since 1958. Dora Hotel Company, LLC owner Tim Dora is proud to continue the family legacy through his Indiana-based hospitality management company. âWe develop awesome hotels that are creatively designed, meticulously maintained and sparkling clean,â Dora said. âWe do this because we love it and we are really good at it.â Dora Hotel Company oversees 20-plus properties throughout Indiana. Tim Dora is a principal in most of the properties, while those not owned are operated under management agreements. The company works with multiple global hotel brands including Hilton Worldwide (NYSE: HLT), Marriott International, Inc. (NASDAQ: MAR), InterContinental Hotels Group (NYSE: IHG), as well as several other 
                                independent properties. Dora Hotel Company specializes in real estate development and management, and owns, develops and/or manages restaurants, office buildings and parking garages in addition to hotels. 
                                The company provides a full range of hospitality services including accounting and financial reporting, purchasing, design and construction services, franchisor relationships, sales administration and revenue management. Our team members are dedicated to providing our guests with outstanding service in impeccably clean and well-maintained hotels. We aggressively renovate our hotels to provide our guests with the highest-quality 
                                facilities in the markets that they serve. We carefully select and train our team members to ensure quality customer service. Our success is achieved by providing our guests with service and facilities that are second 
                                to none, and by maximizing asset values for our partners and clients. For a first-class hospitality experience, visit a Dora Hotel Company property next time youâre on the go â and tell them Murphy sent you. Load more Show less Behind Our Success Tim Dora Tim Dora President Tim Dora holds a Bachelor of Science Degree in Business Finance from the University of Colorado. He is the owner of Dora Hotel Company, a Hotel Development and Management Company as 
                            well as Vision Building Company, a general contracting and construction management firm. Tim takes pride knowing Dora Hotel Company, LLC, is one of Indianaâs most successful hotel management companies. The companyâs portfolio covers a wide range of hotel brands with 
                            locations throughout Indiana. From innovative products such as Hotel Indigo to traditional favorites such as Holiday Inn Express & Suites. Tim and his team develop and manage high-demand properties in key 
                            markets. Timâs properties have been recipients of numerous awards for quality and service excellence including Developer of the Year Award from Hilton Worldwide and Developer of the Year Award 								
                            from Intercontinental Hotels Group. He has been involved in the management, development and opening of over forty hotels during his career in the hospitality industry. He is the former Chairman of the Hotel Indigo Ownerâs Association for Intercontinental Hotels Group. Tim is the past President and Board Member of the Indiana Hotel & Lodging 
                            Association and has served on several hospitality related boards and committees. The American Hotel & Lodging Association has designated him as a Certified Hotel Administrator. He is the former Chairman of 
                            Premier Capital Corporation of Indianapolis, Indiana a Certified Development Corporation of the Small Business Administration. Chris Dora Chris Dora Vice President Chris Dora graduated from Purdue University with a Bachelor of Science in Finance in 2018. Chris joined the Accounting team in 2020. Prior to joining Dora Hotel Company, Chris worked as an Accounting Analyst for J.C. Penney in Salt Lake City, Utah. Wendy Bland Wendy Bland Regional Manager An employee of Tim Doraâs for over 16 years and a hospitality professional of 22 years, Wendy Bland provides a wealth of experience in daily hotel operations, hotel construction, renovations, plus food and 
                            beverage knowledge. During her time with Dora Hotel Company and Dora Brothers Hospitality, Wendy has overseen the construction and opening of over 14 hotel properties including independent, extended-stay plus limited and 
                            full-service properties. During the design and construction phase, her goal has been to accommodate the needs of today's hotel guest while ensuring on-time openings. Wendy has also maintained the role of General Manager and 
                            Regional General Manager of numerous hotels. Her focus has been to train new hotel staff as well as organize hotel procedures to guarantee guest satisfaction long into the future. This attention to detail has helped Dora Hotels 
                            gain a strong reputation of customer service that Wendy is proud to continue. Cindy Waddle Cindy Waddle Regional Manager Ms. Waddle is a graduate of the University of Evansville, with a B.A. in Education specializing in Communications and English. She has been in the hospitality industry for 18 years and currently serves on 
                            the Columbus CVB Board of Directors, as well as serving as Secretary on the Executive Committee for the CVB. She is a member of the Women's Giving Circle of Bartholomew County as well. She has management experience in Food & Beverage, Sales & Catering, and Front Office Operations. She has managed hotels as well as extended stay facilities for Dora Hotel Company for the last 9 years and has 
                            been a Regional Manager for Dora properties for the last 7 years. Ms. Waddle has overseen two renovation projects within Dora and has been the lead operations manager in the opening of the first new-build Hotel Indigo within 
                            the brand. As the manager of the Hotel Indigo, Columbus, the property has won the 2009 Newcomer Award, 2010 Torchbearer Award, and 2011 Torchbearer Award from Intercontinental Hotels Group. Ms. Waddle was awarded the 
                            title of General Manager of the Year for Hotel Indigo properties in 2011. Erica Free Erica Free Regional Manager Erica Free has over 25 years of Hospitality experience.  She has managed many select service properties including dual-branded properties in almost every sector of the business âcorporate, extended stay, franchised, and independent.  She has extensive experience with new openings, renovation planning, and asset management.  Ericaâs commitment and desire to provide the highest customer service is marked through outstanding quality assurance evaluations, employee retention, and high-ranking guest service scores. Most recently as the General Manager at the Hilton Garden Inn, she was able to obtain her MBA at Indiana State University.  She currently serves as an adjunct professor in the Marketing Department within the Scott College of Business at Indiana State University. Kelly Tabeling Kelly Tabeling Regional Manager Kelly's career in hospitality began in 1987 when she bravely kept vacationers safe as a lifeguard at the Holiday Inn. Since then, sheâs climbed the ranks to become a hospitality industry veteran with over 25 years of experience and a key player at Dora Hotel Company since 1995. Throughout her tenure, Kellyâs leadership has shaped many successful properties, from renovations to the opening of notable hotels like Hotel Nickel Plate Fishers, DoubleTree Lafayette East, Hilton Garden Inn, and Hotel Indigo. Her efforts havenât gone unnoticed â her hotels have earned prestigious awards like the Quality Excellence Award and Renovation Award. Her extensive experience spans Sales and Catering, Food and Beverage, New Development and Renovations, and Hotel Operations. As Regional Manager, Kelly now partners closely with General Managers to ensure day-to-day operations run smoothly and uphold Dora Hotel Companyâs legendary service culture. When sheâs not driving hotel excellence, Kellyâs volunteering with Visit Hamilton County leaders or being the ultimate wife, mom, and grandma. All in all, Kellyâs dedication to the hospitality world is matched only by her love for her family â and a good hotel renovation. Eric Groganz Eric Groganz Corporate Controller Eric Groganz is a graduate of Indiana University in Bloomington with a Bachelor of Science in Accounting and Finance. He began his accounting career with Dora Hotel Company in 2013. In 2015, Eric transitioned to governmental accounting working for the Indiana Finance Authority. He returned to Dora Hotel Company in 2019 as the assistant controller. Leslie Mimms Leslie Mimms Chief Financial Officer Leslie graduated from Indiana State University earning her Bachelor of Science in Accounting and started her career in public accounting.  In 1996, she acquired her CPA license in the state of Indiana.  Leslie worked in public accounting for nearly 13 years, while 11 of those years were with the accounting firm Katz, Sapper and Miller working on hospitality clients before transitioning into the private accounting sector.  For the past ten years, she has been sharping her debit and credit skills in the hospitality industry as Corporate Controller of a hotel management company. Leslie joined Dora Hotel Company in 2019 as Controller leading the accounting team with her 20 years of hospitality accounting experience. Mandy Leverenz Mandy Leverenz Mandy is a graduate of IUPUI with a B.S. in Tourism, Conventions, and Event Management, along with a minor in Marketing. She has been with Dora Hotel Company since 2007, starting at the Hotel Indigo in Fishers, IN. Over the years, Mandy has worked at several of the companyâs properties and corporate office, gaining experience in various departments, including Accounting, Operations, Development, and Construction. Her dedication and versatility have allowed her to take on a wide range of responsibilities. Currently, she serves as the Director of Sales at Hotel Nickel Plate, Dora's newest boutique property. Mandy is also an active member of the Fishers community, contributing her time and expertise to several local boards. Outside of her professional life, she is passionate about being a wife and mom, alongside her love for the hospitality industry. Teresa Smith Teresa Smith Accountant Ms. Smith is a graduate of Ball State University with a B.A. in Geography specializing in Travel and Tourism and a minor in Business. Teresa has been in the hospitality business for 25 years, all of them 
                            working for the Dora Family. She began working at the Holiday Inn in Anderson in 1987 and performed duties including Night Audit, Guest Service Representative, and Bookkeeper. In 2007, she transferred to the Holiday Inn 
                            Express-Fishers where she was Front Office Manager. Shortly thereafter, she joined the staff at the corporate office of Dora Brothers Hospitality where she was an Administrative and Accounting Assistant. Teresa began working for 
                            Dora Hotel Company in March 2010 as an Accounting Assistant. Kevin Johnston Kevin Johnston Accountant When heâs not slipping Murphy copious amounts of people food, Kevin can be found crunching numbers in the hallowed stillness of the Dora Hotel Company Accounting Department. Prior to joining Dora, Kevin spent nine years at the now-defunct St. Vincent Marten House Hotel and Lilly Conference Center as the Accounting Supervisor and a Night Auditor. He studied Sports Communication 
                            at Indiana University in Bloomington, and New Media at IUPUI in Indianapolis. Kevin also works as a Freelance Correspondent for The Indianapolis Star, covering the Indy Eleven and other sports, and heâs the Founder and Managing Editor of soccer news outlet SocTakes.com. His drab 
                            musings have infiltrated many desolate parts of the Internet. Born and raised in the Circle City, the Indy lifer has never met a breaded tenderloin he didnât like. He often wakes up in cold sweats from recurring nightmares of debits and credits, but satisfies his 
                            massive OCD with dreams of perfect accordion folds and balanced bank reconciliations by day. Chrissy Johnston Chrissy Johnston Corporate Sales Manager Chrissy Johnston has nearly 20 years of experience in the hospitality industry servicing markets in the Midwest. She began her career in hotel operations at the St. Vincent Marten House Hotel & Lilly Conference Center, eventually becoming the Catering Sales Manager before assuming the role of Director of Sales at the Holiday Inn Express Downtown Indianapolis. Her expertise includes sales, catering, event planning, marketing, social media, and operations. Chrissy studied Tourism, Conventions and Event Management at IUPUI and started her career with Dora Hotel Company in 2013. She currently serves as the Corporate Sales Manager focusing on corporate sales, sales strategy, sales plans, customer acquisition, revenue management, and portfolio expansion. Theresa Gallivan Theresa Gallivan Human Resources Theresa currently serves as Director of Human Resources for Dora Hotel Company. Ms. Gallivan joined Dora Hotel Company in 2013, bringing with her over 20 progressive years of business experience, human 
                            resources management, and enthusiasm for excellence. Her primary responsibilities include employee relations, compensation and benefits, compliance, training and development. Before working with Dora, Theresa was the Director of 
                            Human Resources for St. Vincent Marten House Hotel in Indianapolis. Ms.Gallivan brings a wealth of knowledge and experience to Dora Hotel Company from her extensive background with Hilton Hotels where she gained diverse experience 
                            in Front Office Operations, Sales, Catering, Human Resources, and Administration. Darlene Lambert Darlene Lambert Payroll Manager Ms. Lambert is a HR payroll generalist specializing in HRIS implementations. She also has services in a variety of departments including employment, benefits, compliance and disciplinary issues for all 
                            company associates. Ms. Lambert has led a successful integration of all Payroll and Human Resource programs and policies. Darlene started her career with Dora Brothers Hospitality in 1996. Since this time she has held a number of 
                            key roles giving Darlene the perspective and understanding to be an outstanding Payroll Manager. Liz Hardin Liz Hardin Office Administrator Liz has over 10 years of office management experience. Her background includes working in dental, sales and collections, and her favorite: dry cleaning.   She has a vast knowledge of accounts receivable, collections, marketing, client relationships, and quality customer service. She joined Dora Hotel Company in 2021 as the Office Administrator and Accounts Payable Clerk. Elizabeth Yorger Elizabeth Yorger Construction Coordinator Construction is an integral part of Elizabethâs life, as four generations of her family worked in various construction trades. She is a graduate of William Woods University with a B.S. in Equestrian Science and a minor in Business Administration. She has a broad range of experience in construction administration as well as customer service in the financial services industry. She enjoys traveling and the personal growth that comes through experiencing different cultures. She joined Vision Building Company in October 2017. John Jeffries John Jeffries Corporate Director of Food and Beverage John started working in hotels as a Banquet Setup Houseman while attending West Virginia University, as it was âjust a good job for beer money.â Since starting in that position 20 years ago, he discovered his passion for hospitality and creating memorable experiences, and food and beverage to be a great avenue to deliver those experiences. He has held almost every position in the food and beverage world while climbing the ladder, working for some great companies, and learning from even better food and beverage professionals in the industry. While in Denver, he was the Food and Beverage Supervisor of a 422-room, $8 million food and beverage operation at the Westin Denver Downtown. From there, he was a Food and Beverage Manager of a 250-room Hilton Garden Inn with a Colorado-themed specialty restaurant. He has also been Director of Event Operations for the Crowne Plaza Denver Airport, overseeing 90,000 square feet of meeting space. In 2017, he opened his first hotel as Director of Food and Beverage of the Moxy Denver Cherry Creek, which at the time was only the fourth Moxy in the United States. The hotel was a pilot to serve several crucial changes in the brand, which played a pivotal role in helping Marriott grow to more than 40-plus Moxy hotels. Due to the success of opening Moxy, he assisted his previous company in four additional openings while still leading the Moxy food and beverage team. In 2021, he was promoted to Regional Director of Food and Beverage and moved to Chattanooga, Tenn., where he oversaw 18 properties across multiple brands with revenues exceeding $16 million. John joined the Dora Hotel Company team in June 2024.
